title: 0x8007007b
body:
Not sure if this is the right place, but it seems that the makeAppx Commando doesn't like '.rels'-xml Files, as added by the VS15 Setup.
I ran it multiple times yout to find the reason, but it crashed with this Errors every time, when it got to a '.rels' - File:
MakeAppx : error: Error info: Unspecified error
MakeAppx : error: Package creation failed.
MakeAppx : error: 0x8007007b - The filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect.

comments.body:
Well I run the V15 setup using the Converter, since I wanted to try to install it using the generated Appx, in order to have a version witch uninstalls cleanly and doesn't leave any unneded data in the registry.
I tried something simmilar with sandboxie before, but since VS2013, VS doesn't even start in sandboxie anymore.
These seem to be vsix metadata files and are not meant to be packaged. Why is your app pointing to these files?
